pros: Very collegial, small classes, great colleagues
cons: Budget is highly dependent on enrollment

pros: True family atmosphere. If you get involved, as you should, it is a wonderful, caring place to work. The atmosphere is positive. Most students truly want to learn and be successful.
cons: Decisions are often made by one person. This can be good or bad, but is not democratic.

review_title: Great place but no possibility to grow or make decent money
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Georgetown, KY
pros: My colleagues were amazing and the students are very kind. It's a great environment.
cons: The college has very little money. Retirement is a 2% contribution with a deductible of $5000. Also, only a few professors make more than 50k a year. Because it's a private university, they have no obligation to raise your salary - and they don't anyway.
Unsure if adjuncts have any continuity

job_title: Assistant Director of Financial Planning in Georgetown, KY
pros:
Paid conferences 
Great coworkers
Great leave policy
cons: Financial issues made it hard to compensate employees for their hard work

review_title: The value of working for Georgetown College can be determined on an individual basis and on a staff or faculty position.
pros: There are great students to work with and for a common goal in higher education. Great colleagues who give 100%; long history and traditions with the college.
cons: Staff are expected to work 55+ hours per week with unclear goals and no support, changing missions, and poor leadership. The institution has a history of poor stewardship with funds.

pros: I enjoy working with a group of individuals that push me to work as best I can. It is a great environment to be in and my supervisor is great to work for.
cons: It is not flexible on times and the times I do work are rather inconvenient. In addition to that, there is an issue of not many students consistently showing up.

job_title: Campus Safety Diptcher in Walton, KY
pros: My boss is always willing to work around my class schedule, and my schedule for my other jobs as well
cons: It can sometimes, occasionally mostly be difficult or hard to possibly et hours when necessary and the pay is only minimum wage

pros: Students are great. Complete freedom to teach.
cons: Lack of Facilities, and low pay
